text: I've listened to this game's soundtrack enough at this point that it feels like I actually played MapleStory. It makes for awesome background music while I'm focusing on other things. This theme with its steady beat/guitar combo is perfect for that.
author: SupraDarky

text: Though the game isn't great nostalgia aside, the soundtrack is absolutely timeless. Probably the best OST I've heard in a video game, period

text: No one talks about this, mainly because maplestory fans are all shut-in zoomers, but this soundtrack and game design as a whole was directly inspired by the CD version of The Dynastic Hero AKA Wonder Boy in Monster World.

author: Ben McManus

text:
I played Maple Story very seriously from 2006 to 2010. I stopped playing after the release of the Resistance classes, before the Mechanic class was released. The Big Bang patch in 2010 completely ruined the game that I loved so very much. 
This music is very bittersweet to me. It reminds me of the years of great times I had with my friends and my guild. I started on the Windia server and in 2007 when the Mardia server was created I joined up there, which was where I stayed until I stopped playing. 
I made it up to level 132 as a Shadower, which was severely overshadowed by the Dual Blader class released in 2010 (a major part of why I quit the game). It felt awful to have dedicated years to a character just to have that character be all but made useless.
I absolutely loved my time with Maplestory. That was due in large part to the friends I made on the game. It really was a wonderful experience that I haven't been able to recreate since.
author: Chugalg

text: Wish this game wasn't a MMO, so I could replay it. Too bad, the atmosphere was unique and topnotch.
author: Kainz K.

text: So many good music tracks are buried under terrible games.
author: The Okayed Boomer

text: Right in the childhood!
author: Issus

text:
Can't believe it's been so long since MS was released, and yet they still manage to make bangers every once in a while.
I really miss messing around in this game, spending the whole day just chatting and grinding like a madman, it somehow managed to be one of the best online games I've played, even tho the game itself was rather mediocre, communities are what make MMO's special, games have massive playerbases nowadays, but playing online feels lonelier than ever.
I hope it's just nostalgia.
author: Cheese

text: Ouch. Right in my youth.
author: Sephiko

text: Man, I miss this game. Or rather the time when I played it. So many memories.
